meanings.sent1: Dad used the axe to fell the tall tree in our backyard.
meanings.sent2: The lumberjacks will fell the trees in the forest for timber.
meanings.sent3: The beavers decided to fell the tree for their new dam construction project.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds could fell even the sturdiest trees in the area.
meanings.sent5: The logger's job was to fell the trees safely and efficiently.

meanings.sent1: The strong gust of wind could easily fell the fragile vase from the table.
meanings.sent2: The slippery floor caused him to fell and drop his groceries.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel managed to fell the acorns from the tree onto the unsuspecting hikers below.
meanings.sent4: The magician's trick was to make the cards appear to fell from thin air.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected news seemed to fell her spirits in an instant.

meanings.definition: An area of high and uncultivated land
meanings.sent1: The hikers enjoyed the breathtaking view from the top of the fell.
meanings.sent2: The sheep grazed peacefully on the lush green fell.
meanings.sent3: The children imagined dragons living in the mysterious fell near their village.
meanings.sent4: The poet found inspiration in the solitude of the quiet fell.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the beauty of the rolling fell in his landscape painting.
